summary:
• The Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary in Queensland has stopped allowing visitors to cuddle with koalas due to concerns about animal welfare.
• This move may spark controversy over whether other zoos and wildlife parks should also limit human interaction with animals.
• By taking this step, the sanctuary aims to prioritize the health and well-being of its native species.

• The European Union has imposed new tariffs on Chinese electric cars.
• This move is likely to increase prices for Chinese car manufacturers.
• The tariffs may also affect trade relations between the two regions.

• Police in Ecuador have freed 49 people from captivity after a gang had taken them.
• The hostages were rescued during a raid on the gang's hideout.
• Authorities say they will continue to work to dismantle the criminal organization responsible for the kidnapping.

• Violent attacks in France before a crucial election.
• Attacks have left many people injured or scared.
• People fear violence may continue despite efforts to stop it.

• Ghanaian chef accused of faking Guinness World Records award.
• Chef allegedly falsified records to gain recognition.
• Investigation underway to uncover truth behind accusations.

• A hardliner and a reformist are competing in Iran's presidential runoff election.
• The outcome will determine who becomes Iran's next president.
• Iranians choose between these two candidates on election day.

• Israel instructs Gaza ceasefire negotiators to restart their talks.
• The resumption of negotiations aims to reach a lasting peace agreement.
• Israeli authorities hope that renewed dialogue will lead to a stable resolution.

• Mount Etna erupts with lava at night.
• Vandal cuts off Virgin's head from a sculpture.
• Both events occur in Italy.

• Hurricane Beryl has left many Jamaican homes without power.
• The hurricane caused widespread damage to Jamaica's infrastructure.
• After passing through Jamaica, the storm is now heading towards the Cayman Islands.

• Cup Noodles introduces new smores-flavored ramen.
• This is an unexpected addition to their product line.
• It was not requested by customers.

• Hezbollah launched 200 rockets and drones towards Israel.
• The attacks caused damage in some areas.
• Israel responded with airstrikes on Hezbollah positions.

• A 51,000-year-old cave painting has been discovered in Spain.
• The painting is believed to be one of the oldest scenes depicted through art.
• It dates back an astonishing 51,000 years ago.

• Ukraine accuses Russia of "meat assaults" in its attempts to gain territory.
• The city of Kyiv has many statues that represent the impact of war on its residents.
• The statues serve as symbols of Ukrainian resistance against the ongoing conflict with Russia.

• U.K. election exit polls predict a significant Labour victory, ending 14 years of Conservative rule.
• Keir Starmer is poised to become the new Prime Minister.
• Jewish voters who previously left the Labour party due to anti-Semitism concerns are rejoining.

• Nearly 30,000 people have been evacuated due to California wildfires.
• Former Vice President Joe Biden has admitted to "screwing up" during a recent debate, but vows to continue participating in the election.
• An American citizen was imprisoned in Russia for 12 years after being convicted of drug charges.
